Name: Getting Started
Desc: Start with a low maintenance plant! Green onions, potatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, or basil are great vegetables to kickstart your garden. You can begin planting by using food scraps!

Name: Watering 101
Desc: The #1 mistake beginners make is overwatering! Plants love water, but also love to dry out. Drainage holes are extremely important. Make sure to never let your plant sit in water!

Name: Sunlight
Desc: Growing vegetables in limited sunlight can be a pain. Your best bet is to relocate your pots and containers throughout the day to maximize sunlight exposure. Most plants need at least 6 hours of direct sun daily.

Name: Mulching
Desc: Level up your garden by mulching! Mulch is a combination of materials like grass clippings, leaves, sawdust, and woodchips. Mulching helps with retaining moisture and protecting vegetables from the sun.

Name: Soil
Desc: Different vegetables will thrive in different soils. For beginners, stick with Miracle-Gro® All Purpose Garden soil and you can’t go wrong. This one is rich in nutrients and good with drainage!

Name: Makeshift Pots
Desc: No need for fancy terracotta or porcelain pots. A handy tin can, yogurt container, colander, teapot, or even muffin tin makes the perfect makeshift pot for your vegetable seeds.
